model

Class TileCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Color>
          • model.TileCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Color>, java.util.Collection<Color>, java.util.List<Color>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class TileCollection
extends java.util.ArrayList<Color>
    Specialization of ArrayList to simulate a collection of tiles
    Author:
    jsnhlbr5
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTiles(Color color, int count)
      A convenience method for mass-adding tiles of a specific Color.
      TileCollection drawTiles(int num)
      Selects the specified number of tiles (Color objects) randomly from this collection.
      Color getColor()
      Returns the color of tiles in this collection if it is all one color, null otherwise
      Color getColorIgnoreWhite()
      Returns the color of tiles in this collection if it is all one color, null otherwise; ignores WHITE tiles

      Returns true if this collection contains Color objects that all have the same value.
      TileCollection removeTilesOfColor(Color c)
      Removes the tiles of the specified Color from this collection, and returns them in a new collection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TileCollection

        public TileCollection()
        Constructs an empty collection

      • TileCollection

        public TileCollection(TileCollection tc)
        Constructs a list containing the elements of the specified collection, in the order they are returned by the collection's iterator.
        Parameters:
        tc - the collection whose elements are to be placed into this list
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null

    • Method Detail

      • addTiles

        public void addTiles(Color color,
                     int count)
        A convenience method for mass-adding tiles of a specific Color.
        Parameters:
        color - the Color of tiles to add
        count - the number of tiles to add

      • drawTiles

        public TileCollection drawTiles(int num)
        Selects the specified number of tiles (Color objects) randomly from this collection. If the number of tiles to draw is larger than the size of this collection, then only as many tiles as are in this collection are drawn. The selected tiles are removed from this collection.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of tiles to draw
        Returns:
        a new TileCollection containing the drawn tiles
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter is negative

      • isAllOneColor

        public boolean isAllOneColor()
        Returns true if this collection contains Color objects that all have the same value.
        Returns:
        true if this collection contains Color objects that all have the same value.

      • getColor

        public Color getColor()
        Returns the color of tiles in this collection if it is all one color, null otherwise
        Returns:
        a Color object equal to those in this collection, or null if not all one color

      • getColorIgnoreWhite

        public Color getColorIgnoreWhite()
        Returns the color of tiles in this collection if it is all one color, null otherwise; ignores WHITE tiles
        Returns:
        a Color object equal to those in this collection, or null if not all one color

      • removeTilesOfColor

        public TileCollection removeTilesOfColor(Color c)
        Removes the tiles of the specified Color from this collection, and returns them in a new collection.
        Parameters:
        c - the Color of tiles to remove
        Returns:
        the removed tiles
